title: Sustainable HR Practices
overview: Sustainable HR Practices encompass comprehensive strategies for building sustainable, human-centered HR approaches that develop the 'S' in ESG. This includes creating sustainable strategy, culture and values, recruiting practices, employee engagement and development, performance management, health and wellbeing, and operations that ensure long-term value creation for both employees and organizations.

subcategories.name: People Strategy, Culture & Values
subcategories.description: Defining your strategy, the culture you want to promote and the values your company and your staff embody are critical for a start. This will have a determining impact on how your company is perceived and how much your employees feel connected to it. Sustainable strategies and practices will be the foundation of your actions. This makes it a powerful cultural differentiator to attract and retain talents.

solutions.title: Develop Communication & Engagement tools
solutions.description: Once your strategy, culture and values are defined, communicate them regularly and find ways to engage your staff and wider ecosystem. Think regularity, think simplicity!
internal_comms: Develop simple Employee Engagement survey (EE survey) to measure your employees satisfaction and expectation, and then measure your progresses with your employee engagement plan
Encourage your employees to speak up & brainstorm so you get honest feedback and maximise the number of ideas
Communicate during monthly meetings to your leadership team & your staff
Make some leaders/ employees accountable for reporting progresses. Graphic display of progresses (in the offices, or on your internal communication website, etc...) helps as a reminder
Set up a couple of internal initiatives, driven by motivated employees. One of them can be the set up of a Green Team
external_comms: Define what are the internal initiatives you can communicate to the market (this will attract candidates who are like minded) and to your clients (more and more big clients are sensitive to the sustainable practices, when they do not already have questionnaires in place to measure their partners/ suppliers engagements in that matter)

solutions.title: Include sustainability in Code of Conduct
solutions.description: Incorporate your values in your handbook & code of conduct so it conveys the message that these are important for your company:
areas: Promote inclusion, equity and respectful values, sustainable focus
Encourage policies that would protect rights and wellbeing of more fragile workforce such as migrant workers, aged workers, handicapped workers, etc

solutions.title: Define Sustainable HR Analytics
solutions.description: If you don't measure it, you can't manage it.
approach: Select a few metrics (too many will dilute your focus and impact negatively your results). Ensure they fully align with your strategy for greater impact
Your metrics should be easy to gather, measurable and understandable. If too complex or time consuming, it won't last (if they can be automated, even better!)
Decide who is responsible for gathering the information & the cadence
Ensure your leadership / management team is accountable for progresses and results
Define baseline (starting point), targets and a timeline to achieve them
Decide which metrics you would like to communicate to the entire company versus managers only and which you would like to publish outside
Develop fun, simple, powerful and catchy metrics to encourage participation and engagement from everyone

solutions.title: Build a Sustainable team - BASIC
solutions.description: Green Team, CSR Task Force, Sustainability Team…They have many names, yet the same goal and the fantastic power to accelerate and amplify all actions taken toward sustainability. Choose the set up most adapted for your organisation.
setup_principles: Think transversal. Identify a leader, according to your scope / priorities / objectives... It can be one person from each department
Identify the sponsor or mentor at Executive or Board level responsible to advocate the actions of the Sustainability Team
Officially allocate time for it on your employees worksheets and objectives
Remember that if you give it on top of another job responsibility, it should still be performed as part of the employee's job description
scaling_options: If your team can not manage extra tasks, engage an external consultant that could act as a part-time sustainability manager
When you are ready, or when the sustainability tasks demands it, fight for a full time Sustainability Manager and ensure a budget for a Sustainability team
solutions.quote: 'If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together' (African proverb)
solutions.resource: Here is a quick guide to start one and develop it.

subcategories.name: Recruiting & Onboarding
subcategories.description: Recruiting is the first contact you have with Talents who will join your company. Even for the ones you won't recruit, it is important they get the best experience so they have a good image of your company. This is a unique occasion to broadcast to the market what you stand for, your values as a company and how it translates into the sustainable, high quality recruiting experience you offer.

solutions.title: Adapt your Job descriptions
solutions.description: Focus on what really matters, Unicorns do not exist, neither the candidate with the perfect match!
best_practices: Avoid job descriptions with too many requirements, focus instead on behaviors, competencies you want the candidate to have. Please note that too much requirements will likely prevent female candidates to apply
Mention your values and your sustainable engagement
Allow travel time to be limited and offer flexible working arrangements so you attract different profiles and more female applicants
Allow time for pro-bono projects & personal trainings. Encourage it and advertise it (intranet, testimonies...)

solutions.title: Adopt a sustainable hiring and interview process
solutions.description: Source social companies that can find diverse profiles (returning mums at work) or allow handicapped workers / workers with particular needs or medical conditions to work from home.
sustainable_practices: Promote virtual interviews or get the candidate to go to your office for several interviews in one go
Discuss your sustainability focus & goals in the interview process so the candidates know that is important. Younger generations are more sensitive to the topic
Set up diverse panel interviewers so you get a wider view of the candidate fit and potential
Equip your interviewers with a proper toolkit to represent your company best and with an unified story
Use e-signed contracts & legal documents to avoid printing, such as sleeksignin, adobe...

solutions.title: Set up a sustainable onboarding pack
solutions.description: Incorporate values & sustainable initiatives in your onboarding pack. Go digital as much as possible.
onboarding_plan_components: Explanation of the different departments of the company, their roles and main stakeholders
Important persons to meet during the first weeks
Culture of the company (ways of working, where to find the information, tools used...)
Expectations of the role (objectives at 30/60/90 days)
Buddy system if there is one (someone different from the manager to allow more openness)
solutions.sustainable_pack: If you still need to provide a physical onboarding pack, think about initiatives to provide a sustainable branded pack (T-shirt, notebook, gift card for charities, etc...)
solutions.purpose: Define a proper onboarding plan to speed up inclusion, allow performance & drive longer retention.

subcategories.name: Employees Engagement, Development & Training
subcategories.description: Investing in your employees' development ensures longer retention, better performance and employability. Your employees are your assets, and your role as employer is to ensure they remain at their top, continue to develop skills and adapt to changes in a meaningful and sustainable way. This category helps you to incorporate long term and sustainable practices in their professional development and engagement.

solutions.title: Develop Equity, Diversity & inclusion - BASIC
solutions.description: Focus on whole person, ensure all employees feel represented and develop awareness across different groups (under represented minorities). Use your initiatives to support greater equity between your employees.
solutions.focus: Especially, accompany women and discrimated or under represented staff population to fulfill personal and career development.

methods.name: Mentoring
methods.description: one more senior employee share his/her expertise and knowledge with a more junior (minority) employee

methods.name: Reverse mentoring
methods.description: the junior (minority) employee shares his/her experience, point of view, etc... to more senior leaders to help them get a better understanding of what they are currently experiencing in the company

methods.name: Sponsoring
methods.description: one leader speaks for a younger/minority employee in the organization to help him/her gain visibility

methods.name: Coaching
methods.description: in house or external coaching helps individuals and managers to solve challenges they are facing and develop themselves longer term with greater impact

methods.name: Championing
methods.description: one person acts as a champion for a cause or initiative in the organization, driving the visibility and progresses

solutions.title: Raise Awareness level on sustainability
solutions.description: Sustainability is a new field yet we do not have enough time to wait for the next generation to be educated about it. As a result, helping your staff to grasp quickly the main sustainability concepts is of vital importance.
activities: Organise talks from specialists, movies/documentaries screenings, workshops
This will empower people to have a 'can-do' attitude and help your action be understood better by everyone
resources: Browse our sustainability week kit to find ideas for raising awareness
Browse our toolbox for ideas of movies / documentaries
platforms: Collaborative tools (dedicated Slack/Teams channels, Trello boards, Internal Forums…)
Use your Employee Resources Groups (ERG) as a channel to promote awareness and actions across your company

solutions.title: Invest in Training & Learning - BASIC
solutions.description: Implementing sustainable practices implies a systemic change in companies, and it becomes critical to prepare our staff in terms of change management, agile thinking, creativity ('think out of the box'). In a fast pace changing world, upskilling employees and allowing them to build and adapt their knowledge through personal training, is a critical asset.
department_training: Train the procurement team on sustainable procurement, ESG, carbon management and climate change
Finance team should be upskilled in carbon management & sustainability accounting
e_learning: Invest in your employees to continuously improve their skills or develop new ones. You will allow them to remain on top of their games, with more options in their hands
You can use external online learning platforms to help with your employees general upskilling, both in hard and soft skills

Note that these platforms can also be used to raise awareness of your employees on sustainable matters such as: SDG 17, sustainable initiatives, inclusion & diversity, environmental technical issues and certifications etc
knowledge_repository: Build a knowledge repository of your core processes, the way you do things
It helps you to build a sustainable way of learning what matters, what makes the success of your company
It ensures clarity & consistency in the way your employees do things as well as support your new joiners, newly promoted employees in their journey of acquiring new skills
solutions.soft_skills: Train your staff and offer them opportunities to develop their soft skills such as: change management, critical thinking, problem solving, agility, initiative, resilience, flexibility, disruptive design, systemic change. According to the World Economic Forum, 50% of all employees will need reskilling by 2025. Developing these soft skills will ensure their long term employability remains high.
solutions.digitalization: Digitalise your trainings as much as possible, make them easy to follow in shorter length. You may be eligible to grants from governments.

solutions.title: Tie career development opportunities & programs to sustainable initiatives
solutions.description: You can use programs to develop soft skills & visibility thanks to sustainable initiatives & stretch assignments. This is a win-win situation as it develops soft skills all companies need!
solutions.leadership_programs: For example, your Hipos programs & Leadership programs can incorporate sustainable content (project, training, etc…) and focus on building a sustainable leadership

development_programs.name: Mentoring

development_programs.name: Sponsoring

development_programs.name: Coaching

development_programs.name: Championing

development_programs.name: Employee resources groups

development_programs.name: Talent projects and assignments
development_programs.description: where a group of high potential and committed employees work together towards finding a solution in an innovative and collaborative way

solutions.title: Promote Team building
solutions.description: You can use some of the Team building activities to focus on sustainable initiatives, fund raising, etc... This will strenghten the bond between your teams and allow them to do good, reinforcing their commitment and sense of fulfilment, while having a real impact on communities around us.
solutions.format: These activities can be once-off or be built as challenges over a period of time. You can have teams compete against each others or partnering in your company for a wider involvement.
activity_ideas: set up Sustainability workshops or Sustainability Talks such as Climate Conversation
facilitate Climate Fresks or a Sustainable IT Collage
organise sustainable corporate activities, challenges and games
make community volunteering (willing hearts, etc...) easy
solutions.resource: Browse our sustainability week kit to find ideas for team building activities around sustainability

solutions.title: Encourage pro-bono work
solutions.description: A good way to go further in your sustainability and 'giving back' engagement is to propose and encourage pro-bono missions for NGOs.
implementation: You can do this in allowing a few days per year for your employees to volunteer (some of the ideas in the 'Promote team building' solution above can be used)
Depending on your industry, you can organize some ideathons and hackatons for good to share new ideas for your company or community
If need be, you may consider hiring a third party to organise it
